title: Stock-Trading Ban Gains Traction in Congress
sub_head: Pelosi says she expects consensus to emerge pretty soon on legislation
body:
WASHINGTON—House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D., Calif.) said she expected Democrats to soon reach consensus on restricting stock trading by members of Congress, amid debate over the scope of legislation, including whether to extend a ban to lawmakers’ spouses.
Mrs. Pelosi said she has tasked the House Administration Committee with mapping the best way forward for stock sales in Congress, while also pushing for more disclosure by the judicial branch and better enforcement of existing stock-trading rules.
